Prerequisites: COMPLETION OF BUSINESS ADMINISTRATION IN ACCOUNTING, ASSOCIATES OF ARTS LEVEL COURSES
Course Description: THIS COURSE PROVIDES STUDENTS WITH THE TOOLS AND KNOWLEDGE TO PERFORM ADVANCED COST ANALYSIS, AS WELL AS UNDERSTAND AND USE COST MANAGEMENT SYSTEMS AND MANAGEMENT CONTROL SYSTEMS.
Objectives / Learning Outcome(s) / Major:
1.DISTINGUISHING OF COST ITEMS BASED ON OBJECTIVES AND BEHAVIOR
2.UNDERSTANDING THE LINK BETWEEN COSTS AND ACTIVITY LEVELS
3.ESTIMATING COST FUNCTIONS USING EXCEL
4.USING COST INFORMATION FOR PRICING AND PRODUCTION DECISIONS
5.ANALYZE COSTS FOR A JOB OR PROCESS COSTING SYSTEM
6.ALLOCATING THE COST OF SERVICE DEPARTMENTS
7.USING COST INFORMATION FOR BUDGETING
8.COMPUTING AND INTERPRETING COST AND PROFIT VARIANCES
9.APPLYING MULTIPLE APPROACHES TO TRANSFER PRICING
10.USE OF NON FINANCIAL MEASURES TO MEASURE PERFORMANCE.


ON COMPLETION OF THIS COURSE THE STUDENT WILL HAVE THE NECESSARY INFORMATION TO: 
1. ANALYZE COSTS FOR PRODUCTION AND SERVICE DEPARTMENTS.
2. COMPUTE AND INTERPRET VARIANCES.
3. USE EXCEL AS AN ACCOUNTING, ANALYSIS AND DECISION MAKING TOOL.
4. USE NONFINANCIAL MEASURES TO EVALUATE PERFORMANCE
